SettingsItem.Name: Sampling method
SettingsItem.Description: The sampling method that should be included in the action.

SettingsItem.Name: Match HBM individuals selection to population definition options
SettingsItem.Description: Match HBM individuals selection to population definition. Use population definitions (default), ignore all population definitions or use a selection of properties.

SettingsItem.Name: Select one or more individual(day) properties to filter the population
SettingsItem.Description: Select one or more individual(day) properties to filter the individuals(days) in the population.

SettingsItem.Name: Use sampling weights
SettingsItem.Description: If checked, individual sampling weights are used. If unchecked, the individual sampling weights are not in the calculations.

SettingsItem.Name: Use complete analysed samples
SettingsItem.Description: Select this option to remove samples from individuals for which one or more of the selected substances have not been analysed.

SettingsItem.Name: Exclude substances from sampling method
SettingsItem.Description: Select this option to exclude one or more substances from the selected sampling methods.

SettingsItem.Name: Substances to exclude from a sampling method
SettingsItem.Description: The data of the selected substances will be excluded from analysis.

SettingsItem.Name: Filter on repeated measurements
SettingsItem.Description: Select this option to make a selection of the time points to be included in the action. By default, all time points are included.

SettingsItem.Name: Selected measurements
SettingsItem.Description: The measurements that should be included in the action.

SettingsItem.Name: Resample HBM individuals
SettingsItem.Description: HBM individual data are resampled from the original database using the bootstrap methodology (Efron 1979, Efron & Tibshirani 1993).
